messages.message: it occurs to me that something might be up with the jest webpack tests, it hangs after the test passed, even I run with `-t` with one specific test it can still run up to 20 minutes, just want to check and see if all FE team feels about those tests, anybody knows why it almost always take so long in CI?

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/9868002506/job/27249303510
I set this test with only one case and it clearly finished everything in a few minutes but just keep hanging there until I had to abort the job

```PASS apps/src/flow-review/components/FlowReviewDocumentsDashboard/tests/AssignReviewerDropdown.test.js (5.574 s)
  EnterpriseAssignReviewerDropdown Tests
    ✓ it should be disabled if no documents selected (51 ms)
    ✓ it should be disabled if no deployed solution id (10 ms)
    ✓ it should be disabled if no queue id (18 ms)
    ✓ it should be disabled if selected documents not from same queue (8 ms)
    ✓ it should not call dispatch if queue exists in redux store already when clicking assign reviewer (1564 ms)
    ✓ it should call dispatch if queue does not exist in redux store already when clicking assign reviewer (222 ms)
    ✓ it should have helper text that states it is loading if queue is loading (242 ms)
    ✓ it should have helper text that states it is loading if groups is loading (238 ms)
    ✓ it should not dispatch setReviewer if no current reviewer (246 ms)
    ✓ it should not dispatch setReviewer if reviewer did not change (239 ms)
    ✓ it should show correct options for reviewers (486 ms)
    ✓ it should dispatch setReviewer if user clicks on different reviewer option and then confirms (527 ms)

Test Suites: 899 skipped, 1 passed, 1 of 900 total
Tests:       5794 skipped, 12 passed, 5806 total
Snapshots:   0 total
Time:        1320.822 s```
Test it self took 5 seconds but the whole thing took 20+ minutes
